ETYMOLOGY: From Latin sectio (stem section-), meaning 'a cutting, a cutting off, division', derived from secare 'to cut'.

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Any of the parts into which something is divided or of which it is made up.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 某个整体被分割成的部分或组成部分；区域；部门。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: Please turn to the finance section of today’s newspaper.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 请翻到今天报纸的财经版块。

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A distinct part of a legal or official document, law, or book, typically numbered.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 法律、正式文件或书籍中独立的部分，通常以编号标示的条款或章节。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: He was charged under Section 50 of the new penal code.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 他根据新刑法的第50条被指控。

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A two-dimensional surface or shape that is exposed by making a straight cut through a three-dimensional object; a cross-section.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 通过直线切割三维物体所暴露的二维表面或形状；横截面；切片。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The geologist studied a polished section of the rock to determine its mineral composition.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 这位地质学家研究了岩石的抛光切片，以确定其矿物成分。

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: To divide (something) into distinct parts or sections.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 将（某物）划分成不同的部分或段落；隔开。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: They sectioned off the dangerous area of the construction site.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 他们把建筑工地的危险区域隔开了。

REGISTER: General and academic use, common in administrative and technical contexts.
